<<<<<<< HEAD
Christmas lamentation for the losse of his acquaintance, showing how he is forst to leaue the country, and come to London. To the tune of, Now the spring is come.
1 sheet ([1] p.) : ill.
for F. C[oles] dwelling in the Old-Bayly, Printed at London : [ca. 1635]
Printer's name and suggested imprint date from STC. Verse - "Christmas is my name, farre haue I gone,". In two parts. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======

for F. C[oles] dwelling in the Old-Bayly, Printed at London : [ca. 1635]
